name: Breadcrumb
description: A breadcrumb nav list for apps with and without use of React-Router

name: Button

props.name: callback (optional)
props.description: Function that returns the Event Obj of Component onClick.

props.name: theme (optional)
props.description: Available Themes: default (no theme prop), secondary-border, secondary-dark, text-link, danger

notes: Component also passes down all button related props given (i.e. type, id, autofocus, etc.).

name: CheckButton
description: A nice checkbox-style element that toggles a bool state.
notes: Component also passes down all input & React props given for the ability to control state of a radio group if needed.

name: Dropdown
description: A dropdown-based element that display's its children.
notes: Make sure you set a property of 'position: relative' on the conatiner element.

name: Icons
notes: This Component will also stack children as shown if given.

name: InformationalIcons
notes: This Component will also stack children as shown if given.

name: Input
description: An input that displays either a animating (default) or basic style theme in your forms.
component: <Input basic inputLabel="email" type="email" placeholder="email@example.com" onUserInput={ this._textInput } required />

props.name: onUserInput
props.description: Returns input value onChange (check your console to see work).

notes: Component also passes down all input related props given.

name: Legend
description: A visual used to display a page indicator of where the user is located or something similar.

props.name: activeIndex
props.description: Component styling for active index related dot in group.

props.name: callback (optional)
props.description: Returns the index of dot user selected onClick.

props.name: color (optional)
props.description: Component styling for active index color.

props.name: total
props.description: Tells Component how many dots to create.

name: Modal
description: A way to have dynamic modals within your app triggered from it's active property.
component: <Modal active={ this.state.modalActive } content={ this.state.modalContent } logo={ yourLogoRef } onCloseModal={ this._toggleModal } />

props.name: content
props.description: Displays value into the 'feature' section of Component.

props.name: logo (optional)
props.description: Adds logo in header of Component if given.

props.name: modalWidth (optional)
props.description: Sets a max-width restriction on Component.

props.name: onCloseModal
props.description: Returns 'false' when Component close triggered fired onClick.

notes: Pressing 'esc' key will also close Modal.

name: Navicon
description: A button for mobile or desktop devices that show a toggled state

props.name: onUserClick
props.description: Returns active state Boolean onClick (check console to see this work).

notes: The Navicon Component is absolutely positioned so be sure to put it in a relative positioned container if needed.

name: NavLink
description: A react-router Link-based Component for navigating to specific routes.

props.name: to
props.description: Tells Component where to navigate onClick.

notes: Component also passes down all props given and accepts children.

name: NotificationToast
description: A visual that is used to represent a flash/toast/notification for small messages in the UI.
component: <NotificationToast active theme="error" message="Oh, no! Looks like we weren't able to add your items" />

props.name: message
props.description: Displays value in Component feature section.

props.name: theme (optional)
props.description: Available themes: default (no theme prop), pending, error

name: SelectBox
description: A select-based element which represents a control that provides a menu of options.
component: <SelectBox form label="select item" list={ listArr } callback={ this._updateSelection } name="items" required />
instructions: To use the SelectBox Component, just drop it in and include the 'list' (Array), label (String / optional), 'callback' (func that returns the value of selected option), and optional 'form' (bool) props along with all other select element related attributes (props) needed.
notes: List Array format: [ 'item 1', 'item 2' ] (if no list prop given, will return null)

name: Toggle
description: A checkbox-based input used to visualize a toggle option in a form.
instructions: To use the Toggle Component, just drop it in and include the optional toggleRef (func that assigns a ref variable) and active (bool) props.
notes: Not including the 'active' prop will render toggled disabled as expected.
